name: struct2grstr
params: class c0, class c1, class c2
body: |- wbr(c0, cstr, cop(cfv(cbs, cnx), cfv(cedgf, cnx)))
-| wceq(c0, cpr(cop(cfv(cbs, cnx), c1), cop(cfv(cedgf, cnx), c2)))

body.origin:
|- wbr(c0, cstr, cop(cfv(cbs, cnx), cfv(cedgf, cnx)))
-| wceq(c0, cpr(cop(cfv(cbs, cnx), c1), cop(cfv(cedgf, cnx), c2)))
-| wbr(cfv(cbs, cnx), clt, cfv(cedgf, cnx))
-| wcel(cfv(cedgf, cnx), cn)
body.pretty:
⊢ c0[Struct]<(Base ` ndx),(.ef ` ndx)>
⊣ c0 = { <(Base ` ndx), c1 >, <(.ef ` ndx), c2 > }
⊣ (Base ` ndx)[<](.ef ` ndx)
⊣ (.ef ` ndx)∈ ℕ

cumulated.origin:
|- wbr(c0, cstr, cop(cfv(cbs, cnx), cfv(cedgf, cnx)))
-| wceq(c0, cpr(cop(cfv(cbs, cnx), c1), cop(cfv(cedgf, cnx), c2)))
-| wbr(cfv(cbs, cnx), clt, cfv(cedgf, cnx))
-| wcel(cfv(cedgf, cnx), cn)
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ c0[Struct]<(Base ` ndx),(.ef ` ndx)>
⊣ c0 = { <(Base ` ndx), c1 >, <(.ef ` ndx), c2 > }
⊣ (Base ` ndx)[<](.ef ` ndx)
⊣ (.ef ` ndx)∈ ℕ

cumulated.origin:
|- wbr(c0, cstr, cop(cfv(cbs, cnx), cfv(cedgf, cnx)))
-| wceq(c0, cpr(cop(cfv(cbs, cnx), c1), cop(cfv(cedgf, cnx), c2)))
-| wcel(cfv(cedgf, cnx), cn)

|- wbr(c0, cstr, cop(cfv(cbs, cnx), cfv(cedgf, cnx)))
-| wceq(c0, cpr(cop(cfv(cbs, cnx), c1), cop(cfv(cedgf, cnx), c2)))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ c0[Struct]<(Base ` ndx),(.ef ` ndx)>
⊣ c0 = { <(Base ` ndx), c1 >, <(.ef ` ndx), c2 > }

comment: A graph represented as an extensible structure with vertices as base set and indexed edges is actually an extensible structure. (Contributed by AV, 23-Nov-2020.)
